qas.question: Who created and popularized many of the sports that we love today?

answers.text: British Public schools and universities in the 19th century

qas.question: Why were sports important in these schools?

answers.text: sports were considered a vital tool for training their students to think and act as part of a team

qas.question: Who founded organizations like the FA?
What changed in 1885 due to the FA changing rules?

answers.text: association of football with the working classes

plausible_answers.text: Today's association of football with the working classes

qas.question: What did the British Empire formalise in the 19th century?

context: <b6_0>Many sports popular today<b6_0/> were formalised by <a0_0>British Public schools and universities in the 19th century<a0_0/>. These schools produced the civil servants and military and naval officers required to build and maintain the British empire, and team <a1_0>sports were considered a vital tool for training their students to think and act as part of a team<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Former public schoolboys<a2_0/> continued to pursue these activities, and founded organisations such as the <b4_0>Football Association<b4_0/> (FA). <b5_0>Today's <a3_0>association of football with the working classes<b5_0/><a3_0/> began in 1885 when the FA changed its rules to allow professional players.
